thread.title: Mike Leach is 38th-highest paid coach in the country
thread.title_full: Mike Leach is 38th-highest paid coach in the country

title: Mike Leach is 38th-highest paid coach in the country
text:
Mike Leach is 38th-highest paid coach in the country Leach in the top 40 for highest paid coaches. Petrino near the bottom. Post to Facebook Mike Leach is 38th-highest paid coach in the country Leach in the top 40 for highest paid coaches. Petrino near the bottom.  //on.krem.com/1LkkOe1   Mike Leach is 38th-highest paid coach in the country Darnay Tripp , KREM.com 2:56 p.m. PDT October 8, 2015 Mike Leach against Rutgers CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PULLMAN, Wash. -- USA Today Sports released its 2015 College Football Pay Survey Thursday. Washington State head coach Mike Leach ranked 38th among FBS head coaches, with a salary of $2,750,000. 
That figure is the same as Leach's salary in 2014. A year ago that ranked him 31st in the nation. None of that money came from performance or academic based incentives - which, like this year, could amount to a max bonus of $625,000. 
Now in his fourth season in Pullman, Leach is the sixth highest paid coach in the Pac-12. Washington's Chris Petersen is at the top of the list at $3,402,940. UCLA's Jim Mora is scheduled to take in $3,350,000, followed by Arizona's Rich Rodriguez ($3,238,844), Oregon's Mark Helfrich ($3,150,000), and Arizona State's Todd Graham ($3,002,960).
